alert.note: Alert for Banner; Kimball (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 3:00PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Kimball, southwestern Banner and southeastern Laramie Counties through 245 PM MDT... At 200 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout along a line extending from near Albin to 7 miles northwest of Panorama Point to near Hereford. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph, and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Kimball, Pine Bluffs, Burns, Oliver Campground, Oliver Reservoir, Kimball Airport, Panorama Point, Carpenter and Bushnell. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 387 and 402. Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 1 and 21. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
